org.jplot2d.env

Class RenderEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jplot2d.env.Environment
      • org.jplot2d.env.PlotEnvironment
        • org.jplot2d.env.RenderEnvironment

  • public class RenderEnvironment
extends PlotEnvironment
    This environment extends plot environment to add ability to render a plot.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RenderEnvironment

        public RenderEnvironment(boolean threadSafe)
        Construct a environment to render the given plot.
        Parameters:
        threadSafe - if false, all plot properties can only be changed within a single thread, such as servlet. if true, all plot properties can be safely changed by multiple threads.

      • getDefaultExportDirectory

        public static java.lang.String getDefaultExportDirectory()
        Returns the default export directory.
        Returns:
        the default export directory

      • setDefaultExportDirectory

        public static void setDefaultExportDirectory(java.lang.String dir)
        Sets the default export directory. If the given directory is relative path, it's relative to user's home directory. The default export directory is persisted within a session.
        Parameters:
        dir - the default directory for exporting files

      • getExportDirectory

        public java.lang.String getExportDirectory()
        Returns the export directory for this environment. If this directory is null, the global default directory will be used when exporting a plot.
        Returns:
        the export directory for this environment

      • setExportDirectory

        public void setExportDirectory(java.lang.String dir)
        Sets the export directory for this environment. If the directory is null, the global default directory will be used when exporting a plot. If the given directory is a relative path, it's relative to user's home directory.
        Parameters:
        dir - the export directory for this environment

      • getExportFile

        public java.io.File getExportFile(java.lang.String filename)
        Returns the file for the given file name. If the given file name is already absolute, then the pathname string is simply returned. Otherwise the export directory is used as parent pathname.
        Parameters:
        filename - the filename
        Returns:
        a file object
